result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (8th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (8th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gerald W Rochon was found guilty of OWI (8th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any alcohol or detectable level of restricted controlled substances in blood.
Defendant shall operate vehicles only equipped with IID for a period of 3 years.

Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations including establishment of a driver safety plan.
Defendant shall participate in Victim Offender Impact Panel.  Can be done thru the prison system.

supervisions.notes: AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan.
